one_reviews_text: this game is one of the best games in vr period, so why not 5 stars. Well I would if the game was not so buggy it can become unplayable. you could probably go on listing ever single bug in the game at the moment and it  would probably take 2 hours or more. This will be a great game once most of the unplayable bugs get fixed. Next there are no new event/game modes after 2 years of playing there has only been 2 uniqe events as I can remember, the dark pj red core, and light or dark event other than that its just a repeat of past events, and game modes also fallow this path with the 2 game modes we have not seen in forever solos, and war. Luckily we are getting war back but no news on solo, we just get team death match reloaded 203. Match making is a bit bad for new players but as the game gets bigger that will most defiantly be fixed . This game is a master piece being ruined by bugs, and we only get a major bug update once a month or 2. Big box is try to fix them i hope, but they need to push out more major bug fix updates instead of only updating the game when a event happens and what I mean by this is updates where we need to update the game not updates that are hidden. ps bigbox add more permanent gun please. UPDATE: i forgot to say the servers are so bad the game renders unplayable

The guns are great. They all have a different look & feel - literally, down to the reload mechanics, punchy audio, and recoil patterns. The squad based gameplay and tactical map considerations bring a TON of depth & strategy to a super polished game.

But it's the INCREDIBLE freedom of movement - climbing, falling, and FLYING - that pushes POP: ONE over the top. You have to try it. It's what VR was made for.

Please devs !! Make the game F2P (free to play), dropping the price by $10 at a time. A gradual F2P transition will get many more people into the game, growing sales revenue, without ticking off the full paid players. Ultimately, more players = more in-game purchases, more free (social) advertising, and a deeper community base. Valve did a F2P transition with Team Fortress 2. Obviously Fortnite has had incredible success with free to play, and there's no reason that can't be duplicated in VR despite the smaller hardware ecosystem.

Don't say I didn't warn you. If you play any other shooting games and are left handed, this will be (at least for me) unplayable. I play Contractors, Onward, occ Pavlov, and I am searching for a good BR for quest. This looked perfect. But as a lefty, if you want the gun in the left hand and to ping with your left, the weapon wheel, ping wheel, and quick swap, all stay on the right hand still. OR, you have to flip EVERYTHING, including your movement sticks. Unplayable

I simply will not play this game until a permanent solo mode is released. It is impossible for me (Approaching my mid 20's) to play with all these loud and obnoxious 8 year olds. I know that I am not the only person that feels this way.

i was expecting it to look a lot better but it look horrid and blurry, render distance is supper low as is with anti aliasing with a 1070 only using 50% at 120hz.
if you dont have a swetty squad you'll always be second to the same 5 or so tryhard teams.

This is the only app I use my quest for consistently. Favorite game currently available. There’s always new events and opportunities to earn new skins and level up. Also great opportunities to compete competitively and meet friends

review_title: Communication broken, not worth to get
one_reviews_text: Population one was my first and almost only VR game I'm playing. I loved it so much that I gifted it to my two sons so we all could play together. I'm shy a few games to reach 1000 games but I'm about to quit playing due to all the communication issues, lack of ability to communicate in the game. I would had given this game 5 stars before but it's now down to 1 due to all communication issues.

Great community, super fun, & there's always a lot of free updates and events. Lots of replay value. No one game is the same, different players, and different team mates. Social aspect is great. There are a few bugs, but they eventually fix it, but doesn't stop me from playing.
A solid VR royal, but i'd honestly rather play RecRoyal in RecRoom. How can you call it Population One, and not have a Solo mode? At least a non limited Duo.

The game really needs a solo mode. The 6 year old kids screaming is getting a bit old. Other than that, the game is fantastic, tons of fun. You catch on really quick. Plenty of progression comparable to other battle royale games. Runs great, plays great, and I can't really get tired of it. GIVE US SOLO.

review_title: The game was hyper fun when release

This game is fun when you get use to it.
Hands down the best game on VR. Never gets old and easy to find teammates. There is a tough learning curve but how well the games was made makes it worth it to learn.

It has very good gun and move controls and physic ,also graphics is good but becouse of this big price  , there are very small amount of people in loby and servers.
you must walk alone to whole map all time to met someone.

but from the 56 hours that did get to play it is actually a great game but i just cant play it. Can someone help with this or had the same problem ?
This game has incredible VR mechanics that make it super immersive and action packed!

One of the best games ever!!!
one_reviews_text: Awesome Game!!!

Unpopular opinion I'm sure, but my refund was denied so here we are. Can't play online solo unless the devs grant a timed special event. Pretty lame if you have no friends and are scared of strangers.

the game bugged out and now i cant uninstall or update or install

we need solos

Hello reader. Before you skip, just read the whole thing. I absolutely love this game, dont get me wrong. Climbing around and shooting midair like something right out of an action film, and being able to make plans with teammates on what to do and how to win. I'm gonna give off some pros and some cons here.

Pros:

-Nicely made, good mechanics

-Easy reloading and very smart with the guns

-Being able to fly into windows and easily get good guns off the bat

-Being able to climb around and get the advantages against your enemies, or to just travel

-A storm, to keep things going

This game is all out amazing, but I have some very bad cons everyone should read before buying.

Cons:
Im just gonna write this out instead of naming different things.

The majourity of people who play this game are extremely sweaty tryhards and can snipe you out from 100 meters away. People can shoot you midair with a shotun while flying around you making it physically impossible to fight back. Speaking of "physically impossible to fight back", people can headglitch you from long distances. For people that dont know, headglitching is basically hiding your entire body in cover except your hands, making it next to impossible to even see your enemy by the time they have drained your health all the way. I hate to write this, because I know everyone is thinking "get good" or "youre just bad", but there is no way to even get better when you instantly die to level 60's. Thank you for reading this and goodbye all.

I have mixed feelings about this game. It's relativly hard if you are more recently introduced (because of the players not the gameplay) and gameplay is not really exciting. The guns are simple (but impressive in a way). And there is a BIG crosshair in the middle of the "screen." But then there is the fact that this is the most well made VR battle royale ive played so far in my VR experience. In conclusion, if you have other games you want to buy, buy them instead, but if not buy it, it's a game that is not horrible to play for new experiences( And i cant believe its 30 bucks!)

review_title: Amazing VR Game But cant revive on pcvr
one_reviews_text: Best game ever but a glitch where you cannot revive people when playing on PCVR please fix

games great but i want to stream is there a way to make this game look as good as it does on stand alone quest 2 vs the pcvr version when connected vis quest 2 the graphics aren't as crisp. any suggestions.
before it is a piece of fun, now it is a piece of crap..
GREAT GAME!!!

This game is a TON of fun... When it works. Every time the game updates, PVP becomes completely unplayable on the Rift and Rift S (I don't know how it performs on Quests). The game disconnects, crashes, lags, boots you, or otherwise cannot perform. It will not allow you to interact with weapons, items, place cover, or communicate. More often than not, when we eventually spawn into the game the match has already started, and our characters are left within the zone, already being drained of health. Not uncommon that by the time we get into the match, we've died and our teammate(s) are left to their own. The pattern seems to be that the new patch makes the game unplayable, and it's only after a few weeks do things start to stabilize out and gameplay becomes steady enough to be fun.

This game is a TON of fun, by far the most fun I've had with any VR game in a very, very long time... When it works. From my experience, the Bot Battles don't seem to be as glitchy or broken after updates, so we'll stick to those and see if things eventually iron out, but the devs could use some QA before pushing patches.

review_title: Will keep u coming back for more
one_reviews_text: This really has such potential to be the best mp on quest2 but it is in need of a few key things. Fix wall glitching, fix matchmaking to be fairer much more than already attempted, I also don’t understand why I die with 3 bullets when I empty a clip in my enemy and they’re still walking around even with full health and shields. On the good side of things Graphics and physics are spot on for the quest2 controls are ok. Aiming is a little bit janky especially with free fire reticles “I don’t see the point” however I’ve had some good play sessions with a good chatty word wide community. Had a total blast and made a ton of in game friends. I recommend this if you love VR shooting games but the competition is very hard for sure due to the matchmaking. My advise is find a couple of people in game to play a few games with and stick together and just learn how to mark enemies in the world. Share resources and communicate tactically as much as possible. It has a great community but it’s not noob friendly. You will die and die and die etc. Fortunately there’s a single and coop bot game to play so you can learn the mechanics of the game and I urge you to just play a couple of hours in that first. It’s much fun especially in coop with other noobs. Fly around drink pop eat bananas and build walls like in fortnight. What’s not to like. There’s various age groups that play including very young kids so try to keep language suitable when matchmaking until you build your friend list to play as a team. I’m really liking pop1 every game is different and there’s a ton of unlock-able skins for characters and weapons. I now have a cowboy hat lol yeeehaaa obviously from this season. That’s another great point. It has season passes which pays for variation for everyone every season. It just keeps everything fresh and brings new quests and customisations and new game modes. We’ve been flying through rings like sonic the hedgehog to get a new character skin. Got mine👍

review_title: Good Battle Royale Game but not the best
one_reviews_text: Trying too hard to be the next Fortnite of VR. The reality is there are many Battle Royale games out there, this one was extremely late to the party and in the truest sense - yet another clone. While it has some nice mechanics, it lacks atmosphere. It's the McDonald's of battle royale games, predictable and consistant but ultimately cheap, bland, tasteless. It has been put on too high a pedestal by a customer base whipped into a frezy by facebook funded influencers. If you have never eaten steak - then burgers taste pretty good.

Game was awesome.  Fluid movement and fun to run around with friends.  

-instant wall building destroys gameplay 
-matchmaking is terrible  
-developers going for Fortnite VR (not a compliment)
-there hasnt been a game in past month where i have not been killed by level 50+ and i am level 18. 
-get your shlt together.  casual players are going to disappear.  keep all the hardcore gamers matched up with each other.  a game that was so great a few months ago has nosedived.

Best battle royale/game you could play every day without it getting boring :) 
Goes in the top 2 tier list this game and pavlov. Also no other game comes this close to the fun you experience every time you play! you can climb anything and its hella fun!!!!!
Also i hear something about your neck, just don't be old or strech before play? idk i climb and look up more than im walking and i never had any sores exept my shoulders hehe :)

This game rocks. Consistent playerbase, crossplay between all major vr platforms, great gunplay with a solid learning curve and good weapon balance, matchmaking so new players stand a little bit of a chance(although this area could definitely improve), and consistent weekly updates to keep the game fresh, interesting, and bug free.

review_title: Crossbuy w/ Q2; Airlink makes it better!
one_reviews_text:
Great game that I initially mostly played on my Quest2 as standalone title.
But now with Airlink (and a dedicated router for wireless PCVR), the ability to continue playing this wirelessly while benefitting from 90hz/120hz is a significant upgrade over the base Quest2 experience.

Overall, if you have an optimized router/PC configuration that allows for wireless PCVR, then the PC version is the way to go.
I'm Getting Windows Defender PopUps On My PC Every Time I Open It.
review_feedback:

Could you submit a support ticket at support.bigboxvr.com, so we can help you out?

Thanks for playing POP:1, and I hope to hear from you soon!

- Phillip

one_reviews_text:
Theres been a few moments that have made me question if i really want to continue playing pop one. Currently i am not playing the game anymore but do see myself returning if i hear that improvements happen and they start caring.

My reason for this is a buildup of overpromising and underdelivering.
The competetive aspect of the game is barely supported by the devs, balancing of the weapons happens rarely, when a tournament was anounced that they were going to run it ended up being invite only where it was so pre chosen teams not even based of of community tournaments or anything.

Since the game launched i have seen them say "we do care about competetive" however throughout all this time i havent seen them actually show that they do, i have seen them add a lot of skins and season pass content, some map changes to keep the casual players active but dissapointing to me in the end.
Good

review_title: Pop one is the best game I ever played
one_reviews_text: I got the quest 2 in August of 2020 when they released the pre-orders. I downloaded 11 games in the 1st 2months and of all the games I played, they all left me feeling like it was missing something. I was so excited to get the quest 2 but none if the games out on it met the expectations I anticipated. I saw the previews to Population one and was hesitant to buy it, not because of the price but because I thought I would play it once and never play again like all the other games I bought. But I am so glad I did because I never played a game that had me so hooked and have me looking forward to play again whenever possible. There is only 1 map but sometimes they add different modes or change the map but it honestly doesn't matter. Every game I play gets my adrenaline pumping and I love every aspect of the game. The reaction time from real life to the game is almost instantaneous and there is so many ppl that play the game, you never have to really wait to play a match. Even in the early am hrs theirs ppl from all over the world that play. You also become friends with ppl almost every match you play with someone new. Bigbox hit it out the park with pop one. I bought the game in October and haven't played another game since. If you have vr then Population One is a must have or your library is incomplete.

So I played this on Quest 2 stand-alone sometimes with oculus link but one problem on quest 2 stand-alone it’s takes forever too load up the game but on PCVR it loads up so fast I hope it loads up faster on stand-alone Quest 2 other then that Awesome 
game keep up the good work devs also please fix the quest 2 loading time it takes forever From, Branden Aka Child Of God

review_title: Not as good as I remembered
one_reviews_text: When they took out war the game got worse and worse. Now the game is boring as you play one round and you get killed by a level 50 player. The game used to be five stars and now it’s two.

review_title: if you like cheaters thats your game
one_reviews_text:
When i got the game everything was great, really easy to learn and hard to master, with great community,and gameplay.

The last few weeks the game is infested with cheaters, from people teleporting, to people be able to see exactly  where you are in game. for example i was dead and i waved to the guy that killed me as a ghost and he waved back to me,i even encounter people start flying from the ground.  i have been reporting them but they multiply instead of being reduced.

 until the cheaters thing is fixed i dont really reccomend it.

review_title: if they let me put 6 stars
one_reviews_text: I would. This is a perfect opening to the oculus and what kind of power its packing. Love it

what they sould put in the game is when you reload make it look like you reload like put your fingers on the ammo and also when you climb your fingers should like dig into the wall insdead of have your hands just be in a first but overall its a great game and a must-buy

In itself a nice game, but it is designed for 3 player teams and has no skill based matchmaking. In general it's fun to play and has cool features like flying and climbing anything you want, but if you are like me solo and casual gamer it's probably not for you. You will be shot down in no time by people with 10-15k kills in premade 3 player teams that already have their standard tactics for each part of the map (there is just one map), and you will be paired with 8yo kids that you have to mute because they are arguing with their moms.

I was NEVER any good at battle royales on any platform. Fortnite? Might as well have been shooting at flies... flies with good construction abilites.
I was hesitant to spend so much, but most VR titles come at higher prices so I went for it, and I haven't been dissapointed yet. I haven't played much, but the fifteen or so games I have played have inspired me to write this review, so it must say something!
Population One is fast-paced, thrilling, but also casual: you win some and loose some, and learn and have fun along the way. Being an online game you can expect a few jerks, but the people I've met so far have been awesome. Unlike Fortnite the building mechanic is more of a utility than a skill NEEDED to be mastered and overused (though the shotguns are still overpowered!).
The reloading and gun handling are choppy but fluid and very fun. The locamotives (flying, climbing) make for a more exciting and varied playstyle. Suprise enemies! Take flanks! Throw 'nades and take down squads!
Overall, this game is a must have for VR owners who want an action-packed but still chill battle royale.

The game is great, but after the latest update I got some graphical issues (terrain and buldings/structures not rendering. Can see through them).
RTX 2070

This game is super good and if you don’t have it by now then you’re missing out A LOT

1: It is super fast paced and you will never not be in a game 

2:All of the mechanics are simple and fun

3:THERE IS A REASON FOR VR TO BE CALLED “VIRTUAL REALITY” BECAUSE IT REALLY FEELS LIKE THE GAME IS IN REAL LIFE

4:The only minor setback is that, when climbing, do NOT look up for even 1 minute because after awhile your neck will start to hurt ,but, that doesn’t make any of the game bad.

This game used to be fun, but it's done.
  If you game on Rift S or any other PCVR platform, be warned now:  The developers of this app have specifically written cheats for those on Quest which cannot be used by anyone else.  Launch glitches?  Only for quest.  Do NOT expect a fair game.
  Each time they update the program it destroys more of the PCVR functionality in this game, including things like microphone.  
  Reasons for this?  Only speculation, but likely they want to sell more Quest rigs.  The game itself is meh.  It used to be fun, not anymore.

amazing game. Its so good im at a loss for words... only down side is the climbing and flying mechanics can seriously hurt your neck and shoulders if you overdo it. I suggest not looking up when climbing and limiting sessions to an hour or 2 at most. I havnt played in 2 weeks because my neck is screwed up. The pain only kicked in a day or 2 after, so i didnt realize it was the game causing it... My girlfriend hasnt played in a week for the same reason.

how can i say.... you have to play it ! doesnt matter your gamer skill you gonna love that one. shoot climb fly its online fun straight out of the box ;)

i come back here for a little bug ! too  many up date and to heavy upodate comon guys you ruine my ssd with dose update for insinificant changes work it before you release it we are not all rich ! many games are like that and i cant efford to change my ssd every 2 month !
Devs add features that boggle the mind of any game designer. It's broken and no one stays around to play anymore. Wasted potential.

review_title: A really fun and good game.
one_reviews_text: This game gives me a Fortnite VR kinda vibe but old Fortnite from season 2-4 when players wheren't as sweaty and the game haden't changed too much. I have seen people complayn about sweaty players but I have not seen any one build a five star hotel in under two seconds like in Fortnite. I can't complayn about sweaty players in this game becuz every game has sweats. This game do not have the best controlls. (I wish Big Box VR adds a function to change your controlls and if you know how to change the controlls please tell me) I can't see any big problems in this game but I have some pet peevs like I don't really like the sniper scopes. This game is also a game you could watch on twitch or youtube with no VR experience and undrestand what is going on in this game so this game is a really good game to stream. But I would give this game a Four out of Five.

Climbing and flying around alone is a good time. It's got a similar learning curve as other battle royale's so prepare to lose a lot before starting to regularly get eliminations. Could use a little more original character/style, a more detailed tutorial process, and the ability to play against bots with just 1 friend, But it is already really fun at the moment and stands to grow like many of these games often can.

Since last update (11 th March), the game doesn't work anymore: "Server not responding". I uninstalled and re-installed the game, I tryed without antivirus but nothing works... Always: "Server not responding" !! I play on Rift S.

review_title: Great game but a little repetitive
one_reviews_text:
First of all lemme say the game is fantastic. I am truly impressed with what they’ve done with the game as far as graphics and gameplay mechanics. Unfortunately I must admit that the game can be a bit repetitive due to the lack of options on how to play, and because of the lack of variety I find it somewhat boring at times doing the same thing over and over again. 
You may have read similar comments regarding the need for a sandbox and I completely agree with them. Other than that, it’s a masterpiece.

The computer connected game struggles so incredibly hard to keep any communications working. I would say that Im having serious issues each day, each day is a new type of problem with the voice chat. Brutal!

As title states, this is a good game, a very good game. I enjoyed my time with it so far and even had fun just goofing around. Now, I don't know if this has been said yet but if not, please fix the game up some more. 

I have two important questions for the team:
1) Why is there no menu screen while im in game? If I have to leave mid game for any reason, why do I have to either quit the game entirely or wait til I die/win to get off? Better yet, what if I want to mute someone? What if I want change control styles or movement styles? That is a very frustrating aspect that I have with this game.
2) Why is there no option for contoller remapping? What we have now isn't an issue but I'm not used to it, not when literally ever shooting game has a tried and true method of using a gun. Its ok to use the same shooting mechanics as other games, its not gonna be the death of population one. 

To reiterate, I like this game so far, it plays well, even on quest one and thats great. But please, take the time out of your day to address these problems. I can guarantee you, giving players options and the freedom to play the way they want to will bring more people. Its hard enough to play multiplayer games with almost 0 players because the dev team doesn't care about the users enough to change stuff. I don't want your team to fall into that pit...what you have is great, just please give it the love that it deserves. I know my score is kinda harsh but its done with love because I love VR and I want devs to feel like they are working on the next big thing...because they are. 
I will change my score and recomend this game to others once things change, I can promise you that much.
its trendy

I've been searching for a VR game that'd keep me coming back, and this game happens to be it, it's incredibly fun and addicting. Also, I should mention that I have never encountered any issues with servers, every single time i've got on to play there was never an issue getting into a game full of players, surprising for a vr game, you'd think not many players would be on but that's not the case here!

This is by far the best shooter on VR. I like it way more than pavlov. The new season brought good content. It also improved on the graphics and how well the game runs.....flawlessly. Such a great game. If you like shooters you will L O V E this game!

Ok, lets start of with the positives of this game. It is basickly VR fortnite in a nutshell. However it is so much better than Fortnite. It has a huge and beutiful map, the reload macanicks are really good, the game runs ver smoothly weither on Rift or Quest, and... It has the nicest community i have ever experienced in a battle royale game. The game is really adicting as well. The pin actions are great, and the best thing is the climbing. OMG. You can legit climb anywhere on the map. However there are 2 cons that I would like to get fixed. Con 1, there is this huge tower in the middle of the map that is soooo annoying. It is litterally just there, there is nothing on top of it, nothing inside it, its just in the way of everything. I would rate the map of population one a 7/10 just becuase of that stupid tower. Con 2, I wish their were more weapons in the game. When i just started playing this game when it came out. The first thing I did was go to the combat trial and i was like. "Wow there are so many weapons, {2 shotguns, 3 pistols, 3 ARs, 2 snipers, and 3 SMGs, also a grenade.} Ans i know that sounds like a lot of weapons but it really isint. I feel like instead of hosting all of these events they should add new weapons. I feel like that would be the best way to keep the game from getting stale.

Great game for anyone looking for a fun relaxed battle royale. But note, This is quite literally the furthest you can get from a milsim or an onward feeling game. That being said, its very fun. The only issues I found were the guns feeling jank, the loot spawning being terrible and the crosshair is the most unneccesary thing in the game.

this game just feels like all around sh!t. theres hundreds of kids under the age of 10 r@ping your ears at all time. compared to any vr shooter out there this belongs at the bottom. i want my money back wayyy overpriced for a game that feels so undeveloped. also building is trash, useless
Literally the only "good" mechanic in the game is climbing. That's it. Then you have sweaty try hards you're matched with every time.

this is the most accessible, fun, fast moving battle royale in VR. It’s accessible because it has perfect cross play out the gate with cross platform friending, and joining a match takes seconds. there’s a high skill ceiling and a hella fun grind for skins and leaderboard spots. the guns support a wide range of play styles and team tactics and communication make a good team scary. 

See you on the battlefield. 
(Received product for free)

Don't buy if you're expecting a Last Man Standing game. Contrary to the title, this is a three-person team game with no way to join an online match solo.

Maybe I could even enjoy the team variant, if the game stopped changing audio devices by itself. Even in the audio device selection in settings, the outputs don't match menu positions. Also, my mic doesn't work most of the time, but this might be an Oculus Link issue.

Other than that, collider bugs (bullets stuck in invisible doors or enemies' ghosts) take away from otherwise fun shooting sessions.

These sorts of things could be forgiven if this was a $4.99-$9.99 game. But it isn't.

Edit: Since none of the aforementioned issues were fixed and now I'm stuck with an additional motion-sickness-inducing bug (head is not tracked vertically unless it leaves the general area of calibrated height), I'm forced to update my review.
Also, just noticed that when you bend your index finger in this game, your VR finger... straightens.

Fun time. Played for 5 hours straight. The gameplay is addicting. Grab some friends (or fist bump some people in game to make some!) and play one of the best VR shooters out there. I will update when I have lots of hours but for now I can say that I do not regret my purchase AT ALL.

Bit overhyped. Bit overrated. Its an okay game with a single map. You spend 3/4 or more of the time flying around and picking things up and 1/4 or less near any combat. At the point combat starts the map is so tiny that there are multiple squads on top of each other for complete chaos. Its arcade like and cartoony in the sense it doesn't feel realistic at all when shooting. No sort of real physics. This is fine for me, I dont need real physics if its fun and with friends this game can be fun. I doubt I'll play this much personally but I'll check on it every couple months or so to see how it develops.
good game c:

review_title: This is what VR was meant to be
one_reviews_text:
** REVIEWED ON THE QUEST 2 USING LINK **

This is by far one of, if not the best VR shooter. First of all, I wanna say I’m super picky with VR games. Whenever a game is “pretty good” that usually means it’s a pretty bad game in my eyes. But this game, is so well made. You can clearly tell how much the developers have cared about developing this game. 

Here’s a pros and cons list:

Pros:
- Variety (this game offers variety, you have climbing, building, gliding, reviving, progression systems with skins and very well made weapons which all make up for a fun and non-repetitive game)
- Beautiful graphics on the quest (I’m surprised by how well this game looks on the quest 2. This is PC quality right here.)
- This was made for VR! (Amazing implantation of VR, example fist bumping someone in a game will add them as a friend)
- skin system (like I mentioned earlier. There’s a progression system that rewards you with skins for both your character but also weapons. And they actually look good compared to other games that feature a similar system.)
- Big map on a small quest (there’s a lot to discover here. What will be your favorite landing spot? Honestly, I love just landing in new areas and discovering everything, I’m pretty sure that the devs mentioned that they will update the map  in the future which adds even more to the replayability. 

Cons
- Bad finger / gesture tracking (I’m really nitpicking here, there really isn’t much bad to say about the game but there’s not really a way to point or to make a thumbs up)
- Nothing that tells you about how weapons work (when I first played this, I had no idea how different guns worked which resulted in me dying. For example i picked up a CX4 believing it was a full auto, held in the fire button and it was a single fire weapon and i died lmao. This is a good thing if you like exploration and surprises in games. So this might aswell be a pro lmao

Summary:
This is the future of BR games. Get it now, 5/5.

The good: 
- Addictive arcade battle royal gameplay  
- Awesome climbing and flying mechanics and balanced weapons 
- Cross buy on Quest/Rift and cross play with Steam players 

The bad 
- Addictive arcade battle royal gameplay  
- Only one map and only one squad mode currently (3 players)  
- Annoying lobby system of people screaming/shooting  

Having played both the Quest version (on Quest 2) and Rift version (Quest 2 via link) I thought I would give you my thoughts on the Rift, as this version I can be more critical. 

If I could give you a (2D) PC game comparison I would say it's cross between Fortnite & Ring of Elysium. Currently it's 3 player squads, with 6 squads = 18 player Battle Royale. Like Fortnite, you can pick up resources and build shields/plates to protect yourself and climb on. 

The mechanics for climbing and flying are totally nailed, and the game feels very fluid. There are various VR comfort levels, including the essential option to turn them all off and have smooth turning.  

The weapon mechanics are decent and feel balanced. The sniper scope is a bit 'meh' and this doesn't look that great even on PC with the highest graphics settings. Shot damage is displayed like Fortnite, where hit points are displayed when you hit your opponent. 

PC performance on an Intel 9900k and 1080Ti and Quest 2 (link) runs very smooth on highest graphics setting, although for some matches I've had random performance issues for about 30 seconds which tend to settle down and disappear.

Finally, a minor point if you plan to live stream/record this game, there is no easy way to manage the very noisy lobby start area (other than muting every player). FAO: Dev Team, a setting to pick a seperate audio device for voice chat would be very handy for content creators on PC

I would give it 3.8 in its current form for PC. I hope the player base grows and more maps and modes are added. Oh and having played it on Quest 2 (standalone) it plays brilliantly on that too

As a wise man once said "monkey simulator" he is corect, monkey simulator
there nothing reslly to do in this game!

Most people will not realize, in time to refund the game, that they are just cannon fodder for someone else's pleasure. 

You will not win often without team tactics. Communication is very important. The PUG's that I was in, did not communicate, at all. There was no plan. We wandered about trying to find guns, ammo and shields. But, not as a team. We went our own way without regard for the others. Both of my PUG's were like that. Yes, I was guilty of it, as well.

If you have people that you KNOW, to team with, you are at such a big advantage over PUG's. Your communication alone will win that battle. 

But, there are even better teams. They not only communicate well, they move as a well oiled machine. Everyone knows where everyone else is and what they are doing. The military units.

I cannot compete with them. I would die game after game, for someone else's pleasure. I have better things to do.

REFUNDED!

This game is everything you could ask for in VR battle royale.  So much fun. Quick to join matches, great game play and flying is an excellent twist. The only thing I want is more.  More maps, more weapons and boosts. Maybe a jet pack in a future update? This game is top of my play list and is going to stay there for a long time.

RNG rules all here, so good luck finding something useful B4 another team drops on you in the 1st minutes of the game.

If you are killed your ghost sight is about 10 meters and walking speed and flight times are both Halved, making you useles now and a detriment to your team later when you finally catch up to them, begging for a heal while they're surrounded by a tennis court sized play area consisting of the few teams still left trying to destroy eachother.

3 stars for good marketing but bad gameplay mechanics.

review_title: This game will keep you saying one more.
one_reviews_text:
I have been watching this game for a long time since 2019 and around when the first leaks were leaked, and the game looked alright. I didn't think it was going to be anything special though I thought it was just going to be another VR game that was meh, but the moment I stepped in with my friends I absolutely adored this game we played around 19 matches and it was really late and we kept saying one more game. This game will make you want to hop in another match. Plus this game does one thing that Stand Out battle royale, Pavlov, and Onward could not do it keeps the players coming back for more. Once I got off all I wanted to do was to hop back in and play. This game is the game VR needed.

(I'll see you in my scope)

I played this game for almost an hour now, fully expecting to feel nauseous afterwards. I did not! This game is action-packed and the controls just make sense when you use them. Whether it's flying, breaking down doors/windows, climbing, or shooting, the game is very well put together. The comfortability settings with smooth locomotion are great, don't let that be con when buying this game. More like 4.5/5 because I don't believe any game is perfect, but it sure is close!

review_title: My new favorite multiplayer VR title
one_reviews_text: At first for the first day I was having issues hearing people but I got on again and it was fixed. Now I can say it is my favorite multiplayer title and my second favorite VR title begins Half Life Alyx (that is impossible to beat). Extremely well put together controls are so intuitive everything plays so nicely. Amazing game recommend to any one

If anyone tells you the graphics are good then they have given up and accepted that AAA content isen't going to happen for VR.  The maps lack any sort of detail, it all looks like it was built out of lego or designed by a 10 year old.  Imaging Battlefield were about to release the next title and the graphics looked like this, it would be all over,  every gaming mag would be calling for blood.  STOP accepting this crap guys.  Half Life Alex is a prime example of how VR games can look and still run smoothly, and thats the level of experience I want everytime, not this cheap, non emmersive fluff from second rate games developers !!

On to the game play.  Meh!  Whey am I having to use a F***ing rose to select weapons in VR.  There are so many prime example of how invantory can be accessed and swaped and they chose a rose!!!  I want to put my pistol on my hip, my riffle on my back and a grenade on my belt like I do in nearly every other decent VR shooter.  Hell I'll even slip and banana into my pocket, it might just scare the enemy, but hell no to the rose system!!

Guns Suck!! The gunfire looks and sounds hollow!  

Also if it wasn't bad enough I've rarely been in a game with so many kiddies, and talking 10 year old boys!

On reflextion I think I'm going to get a refund!

The game is amazing, i always procastinate going into vr, and i kinda have to push myself too to get going and eventually ill be fine. BUT population one WANTS to make me go into vr, It makes me excited to wake up that day and have a fun time in population one. also the fact they have CROSSBUY is AMAZING. THANK YOU SO MUCH.

review_title: Super awesome, not perfect, but great!
one_reviews_text:
So this game defintiely fills the BR in VR itch for my friends and myself.  Short version--fast tempo, quick queueing (for now 10/23/2020), great weapon selection.  Weapons are  a little arcadey, but it fits and feels good (imho).

Is it perfect?  No, some bugs noticable--how do you exit without basically having Oculus close program (or end task)?  Why does it not set my sound to my Rift S, instead sending it through the desktop speakers unless I manually go into my PC's sound settings before I launch the game and do this (don't have to for other games in my Oculus library).

Now if they could only enforce the "T" for Teen rating that would also be a big feature request too.  ;)

PROS:
if you love Warzone or any BR games this is the one for you fast and easy to learn controls. hop in game right away, shooting is fun, climbing and gliding with ease. just a great game.. i recommed this game is a must have!!

NO CONS:
lol

Because of that, I'm confident in saying that this is a game with lasting power. I wish I had a group of friends I enjoyed playing with, but it's a ton of fun even with randos.

review_title: Do your self a favor, and get it!
one_reviews_text:
This game… this game is the most open world do what you want multiplayer shooter I’ve ever played. Imagine walking around talking to your squad mates, bullets zip&fly by your face, you break it for the nearest building, climb up the side of it like spider man, bust open a cold soda and slug it, pull out a UMP reload then fly off the top like tom cruise in mission impossible and let out 45 rounds on the enemy, pull out a shotgun blast 2 off at his teammate, drop a quick wall down then chuck a grenade over to finish them off... Yeah this game is tops. 

Most social game I’ve played and by far the most fun I have had in Vr in years. So much fun I had to buy it again on quest so friends can play over at my house with me. Yes the graphics are not your Triple AAA Cod graphics most console players are used to but they are still above decent, and it’s not the graphics your buying, it’s the amazing experience of slapping on that headset and forgetting the real world and this game really does this. The community is awesome find my self squading up with the same teammates almost every random game I get into. The devs and their team really knock it out the park, hopefully we will get monthly updates like most games would love to see this game being the reason people go out and get a headset and get into VR!

Quick background I have had VR for a few years now and have played countless hours & games on the rift and quest.

Quest 2 + Link review (fidelity set to max)
Game looks great and performs well, Frame response times were good ( No nausea ) and in game performance was on par. Far distance viewing was easy. 

  Quest 2 standalone review
Game looks great and the fidelity is very close to the pc tethered version. Performance was excellent and equal to my PC experience , also no nausea. Viewing distance was good. Might switch to playing standalone exclusively. 

  Quest 1 + Link review (fidelity set to max)
Game looks good but definitely takes a hit due to the Quest 1's lower resolution, otherwise it performs well and frame response times were good ( No nausea ).

  Quest 1 standalone review  
Game looks rough, but that’s understandable due to the Quest 1’s hardware. The performance isn’t bad but I did experience slight nausea which no other version caused. Still playable and fun. 

  The game is definitely worth adding to your VR FPS collection, my only current gripe is the implementation of the sniper rifle zoom. Great work devs.

Update: Starting to get a little boring, hope they add content quickly.

I've never played a Battle Royale game before, and never wanted to. I tried this game out and it's very fun. Genres in VR are completely different from their pancake counterparts. Give this game a try.

Only polished VR battle royale game and it's amazing. People complain about bad graphics and "why port to the quest?" like if virtual battlegounds and Stand Out have better graphics. And the graphics in general are pretty good for a PC game and anti-ailising is amazing so no shacky lines and thinks look sharp from far (depending on headset because resolution). And performance is amazing! Would HIGHLY recommen, I didn't like most VR battle royales but this game has set a new standared for VR battle Royales, Its pretty much the Saints and Sinners of VR battle royales.

review_title: Very well balanced for all players
one_reviews_text: The game is incredibly enjoyable right from the start, allowing even new players to get kills, but then you realize that by talking to your team and employing real-world combat strategy that you can really progress far in the game.  Flanking, suppressing fire from high ground, bait and retreat, sniping all have have huge benfits in-game and keep you learning to get better while you're having fun.  The great skins are just icing on the cake.

Very fast paced action with only 18 players in a match and a rapidly shrinking playzone. The Vertical Combat System is awesome as you can climb literally anything you see within the map. My only complaint is the graphics and somewhat limited amount of weapons but I'm sure the devs will find ways to improve and expand the game over time.

This game is a must-have if you like fast paced, competitive VR shooters.

I have been beta testing this game since 2018 and since then I've seen it change and grow into the monster that it is today.  A few other games tried to do battle royale to some degree of success but nothing like Population:  One.
The problem with some of these multiplayer games is that no one is playing them, but this is not an issue with Population:  One.
This is fast paced arcadey game.   Games last 15 mintues and its addictive as heck.
It isnt a milsim.
You wont crawl through brush, eat rations, wrap bandages, calculate wind speed and bullet drop, you cant pull a grenade pin with your teeth and roll it under a semi truck, no this is not that.
What you can do is play a fast paced game with a squad of 3, find guns and ammo, fight off enemy teams, and take their loot.   
Rinse, Repeat, Win.

I played desktop BRs for a bit and eventually just got bored of them. VR BR, Population: One though? Actually dope. It still has that BR feel of sometimes being a bit away from the enemy... but at the same time you don't ever feel like you're hiking for 30 minutes only to die from a sniper in a bush 100 leagues away.

I've been patiently waiting for this game for about 7 months or something, and good lord does it live up to the hype. The climbing and flying mechanics are perfect. Adds so much verticality to a game. This game feels like its been ruggedly play tested.

First I want to start by saying that this is an amazing game and im planning to put many, many hours into it, but the AWP is, in my opinion, the worse gun in the game. Worse than the pistols. I hate how it force zooms you in and block 95% of all of your vision. I know this may be to keep performance balanced, but please, i would love an option to use a regular zoomed scope on the gun. (similar to the Sako but zoomed) That would make the AWP much more use able. That is the only issue I have with this game but other than that it's very enjoyable.

PS.  Melee weapons would be a blast to have.

review_title: Best VR Battle Royale right now
one_reviews_text: I had my eye on this game for months now and like many other games in 2020, I was cautiously optimistic about it. Many games now show you one thing and you receive something else. Not with this game. From my first drop i was hooked. The pregame lobbies are fun and give you chance to feel out the guns or be silly and hug and high five your teammates and enemies. Dropping into the game it is your squad of 3 versus 15 other people. Your objective is to be the last squad remaining. The game features 11 guns for you to use and for the most part they're all pretty balanced. The game also features a gliding mechanic. You jump and spread your arms like you are using a wingsuit. This is a very unique and fun way to traverse the map. I found myself in a couple of games fighting another team in the sky, it didn't end well for my squad but I had a heck of a time. The game feels super rewarding for getting a win. The game also features a leveling system where you can unlock skins and weapon skins for free with the purchase of the game. So no $15 battlepass purchase necessary. It is limiting but it's a start. One thing I love about Population One is the game has so much room for you to perfect your play and grow as player. What's causing me to not give this game a 5 star review is a couple of things and I am knit picking at this point. I'd like to see an improvement in the friends list compatibility. What I mean by this is if you add a person in Population One you'll then need to re add them into the Oculus friends list. Another issue I have is not that the game is short on content by any means but adding a Solos, Duos and Squads mode I think would really increase the games life. Also increasing the player count to 30 would be a added bonus sometimes when you're getting right into the game and you get your first squad wipe as a team the game ends. My last point would be I would like to see a increase in the customization options for your characters. Adding hats, different gloves, or even pants and shirts make a huge difference and really make your character feel unique. Right now there are just preset character modes you get by leveling up. Again, I am knit picking here and these are just my opinons. Overall this game is tied with Zero caliber as my favourite VR FPS game and have meet so many amazing people with this game. I cannot wait to see what the future has for this game. Well done, devs.

review_title: Solid so far, but needs privacy settings
one_reviews_text: Gameplay is solid and pretty fun, however there needs to be some additional privacy settings -- make it possible to mute people in squads (was harassed by another in one of my games) and give squad leadersthe ability to lock squads (or solo/dual modes).
I like Bananas

I really like this game and made me use my vr some more. I have my expectation high or some s**t but most game dont excite me or catch my attention for that long. This one does and its a solid BR shooter while i play. I just hope more people start to buy it. They only gripe I have is that it feels like there isn't that many players in one match. Takes long for me to sometimes find enemies. 
Most people wont like this opinion, but it would have probably been better to make it free for more people to play like warzone, fornite, and apex legends. You could have monotized it with battle pass or skins. Anyways, im still enjoying it and hope you continue to support it.

The amount of polish that is in this game already is something all devs should strive for.  It feels complete with room for expansion, no game breaking bugs seen so far and the player base is very strong with a very low level of toxicity.  Gun selection is massive and the controls feel so natural which makes the game very easy to pickup.  Keep up the great work devs!  Lets hope you continue to develop this gem and keep this player base strong long term.

review_title: Is It Worth The Money. YES!
one_reviews_text: So i was not a beta tester but I did see the concept. When I heard the price tag I thought it was pretty good. Then the news came out that this game will have Microtrsnactions. So you need to buy the game just to play and have a deafult avatar. Then thats what kinda took away my support for the game. But at realase Population:ONE will not have any microtransactions. I think if you buy the game you would get a couple of free "Battle Passes" like if its 9.99 MSRP for a Battepass then you would get 3 free battlepasses or they might never have any microtransactions at all.

This game is so fun, the mobilty is amazing. I'm like a shotgun equipped flying squirrel. If I were to ask for anything more, it would be better graphics and sound. I'm assuming it's toned down for cross platform support. The smoke and explosions look like N64 sprites. Rocks are low poly models. Building interiors are barren and empty. The sound could use work too, footsteps are hard to place exactly where they came from.

Thankfully the gameplay more than makes up for the graphical and sound nitpicking. I hope it becomes popular and funds the devs to put more work into it.
Im running on rift s with gtx 1060 and the game is amazing but the only HUGE problem i have is when i shoot i lag like crazy and thats kinda not fun so yea, hope it gets fixed

So, I was a little reluctant to buy because of the price and inexperience with battle royale type games but because of the high ratings I thought “what the heck!” I’ll do it. So, after the quick introduction to movement and weapons training, I was gunning in no time.

Just some advice for new commers:
(Tip 1.) Stay with your team. This isn’t a solo thing. So, if you think your goanna squat alone in a tower with a sniper rifle- think again! The battle zone shrinks every minute or so. So, it’s fast paced and loads of fun. 

(Tip 2.) Spend 10 minutes or more killing battling bots in training mode until you get use to picking up ammo and navigating the controls. 

(Tip 3.) Your team may not be from your part of the country. So be mindful, respectful and enjoy the open mic chat. 

*Only downside, I wish they had over the shoulder weapons storage instead of a pick and click menu. 

It’s a lot of fun and worth the price.
Great great game. The gameplay is absolutely perfect.

This is dat sticky icky, dat ooey gooey. Dank. Honestly can't say much other then what other already have. It checks all the foundations at least. What does it need? Better networking/servers. More modes. More weapons Ie; LMG and maps with Biomes ; desert, snow, woods. Gadgets Ie; Jetback, Grapple hook, Bubble Sheild. Finally a slower paced game mode, maybe when they finally get squads of 4 in you really feel that zone on you sometimes and its not like people are camping much...yet? Anyways this is probably the best thing on Oculus atm

I was unsure how balanced it would be with unlimited climbing and gliding but it actually plays really, really well. The feeling of flying from a rooftop through the window of an adjacent building to get a kill is magical. I played my first match this morning, died and took a break, decided to try one more time and subsequently played over 60 matches. I was hesitant to rate it 5 stars because there *is* some room for improvement, but it's already good enough for this rating IMHO.
